AuthInfo

AuthInfo

Handles persistence and fetching of user authentication information using JWT, OAuth, or refresh tokens. Sets up the refresh flows that jsForce will use to keep tokens active. An AuthInfo can also be created with an access token, but AuthInfos created with access tokens can't be persisted to disk.

Constructor

new AuthInfo()

See:
  • https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.sfdx_dev.meta/sfdx_dev/sfdx_dev_auth.htm
  • https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.sfdx_dev.meta/sfdx_dev/sfdx_dev_cli_usernames_orgs.htm

Do not directly construct instances of this class -- use AuthInfo.create instead.

Example
// Creating a new authentication file.
const authInfo = await AuthInfo.create(myAdminUsername, {
    loginUrl, authCode, clientId, clientSecret
});
authInfo.save();

// Creating an authorization info with an access token.
const authInfo = await AuthInfo.create(accessToken);

// Using an existing authentication file.
const authInfo = await AuthInfo.create(myAdminUsername);

// Using the AuthInfo
const connection = await Connection.create(authInfo);

Methods

(static) clearCache(username) → {boolean}

Forces the auth file to be re-read from disk for a given user.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
username string

The username for the auth info to re-read.
Returns:

True if a value was removed.

Type
boolean

(async, static) create(usernameopt, optionsopt) → {Promise.<AuthInfo>}

Create an instance of AuthInfo for the provided username and options. If options are not provided, attempt to read the authorization information from disk.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
username string <optional>

The username for the authentication info.
options OAuth2Options <optional>

Options to be used for creating an OAuth2 instance.
Throws:

  • {name: 'NamedOrgNotFound'}: Org information does not exist.

    Type
    SfdxError

  • {name: 'AuthInfoCreationError'}: Org information does not exist.

    Type
    SfdxError
Returns:
Type
Promise.<AuthInfo>

(static) getAuthorizationUrl(options) → {string}

Get the authorization URL.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
options OAuth2Options

The options to generate the URL.
Returns:
Type
string

(async, static) hasAuthentications() → {Promise.<boolean>}

Returns true if one or more authentications are persisted.

Returns:
Type
Promise.<boolean>

(async, static) listAllAuthFiles() → {Promise.<Array.<string>>}

Get a list of all auth files stored in the global directory.

Returns:
Type
Promise.<Array.<string>>

getConnectionOptions() → {AuthFields}

Get the auth fields (decrypted) needed to make a connection.

Returns:
Type
AuthFields

getFields() → {AuthFields}

Get the authorization fields.

Returns:
Type
AuthFields

getSfdxAuthUrl() → {string}

See:
  • https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.sfdx_cli_reference.meta/sfdx_cli_reference/cli_reference_force_auth.htm#cli_reference_force_auth

Get the SFDX Auth URL.

Returns:
Type
string

getUsername() → {string}

Get the username.

Returns:
Type
string

(async) init(optionsopt) → {Promise.<AuthInfo>}

Initialize an AuthInfo instance with the options. If options are not provided initialize from cache or by reading from persistence store.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
options OAuth2Options <optional>

Options to be used for creating an OAuth2 instance.
Throws:

{name: 'NamedOrgNotFound'}: Org information does not exist.

Type
SfdxError
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
Promise.<AuthInfo>

isAccessTokenFlow() → {boolean}

Returns true if this is using an access token flow.

Returns:
Type
boolean

isJwt() → {boolean}

Returns true if this is using the JWT flow.

Returns:
Type
boolean

isOauth() → {boolean}

Returns true if this is using the oauth flow.

Returns:
Type
boolean

isRefreshTokenFlow() → {boolean}

Returns true if this is using the refresh token flow.

Returns:
Type
boolean

isUsingAccessToken() → {boolean}

Returns true if this org is using access token auth.

Returns:
Type
boolean

(async) save(authDataopt) → {Promise.<AuthInfo>}

Updates the cache and persists the authentication fields (encrypted).

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
authData AuthFields <optional>

New data to save.
Returns:
Type
Promise.<AuthInfo>

update(authData, encrypt) → {AuthInfo}

Update the authorization fields, encrypting sensitive fields, but do not persist.

Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
authData AuthFields

Authorization fields to update.
encrypt boolean true

Encrypt the fields.
Returns:

For convenience this object is returned.

Type
AuthInfo
